title: Many Black Voters Like Joe Biden, but Some Are Open to Other Democrats
text:
Kim Solomon was surprised to see Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris seated in the first row of pews at Royal Missionary Baptist Church in the predominantly African-American city of North Charleston, S.C.

Ms. Solomon, of Huntsville, Ala., was in town visiting relatives on a recent Sunday, when Ms. Harris turned the pulpit into a temporary campaign stump. Ms. Solomon has been supporting former Vice President Joe Biden and knew almost nothing about the California senator, who is black, but she is now considering...
description: Black voters in South Carolina have been key to Joe Biden’s standing in Democratic primary polls, but interviews suggest these supporters could be persuaded to support another candidate.
